Posts.Content: torontomom wrote: I had a cnb after a suspicious ultrasound (mammogram was clean). the result was inconclusive, but recommended excission biopsy, which i had last week. I am now waiting for results. But, I am wondering if anyone can send light on the nature of my first pathology report: diagnosis: occasional features suggestive of papillary lesion, epithelloial proliferation present. comment details include " The stromal contains a localized area of dense fibrosis and looser cellular fibrous proliferation - this looser area is suggestive of reactive change. There are occasional irregular monotonous epithelia fragments entrapped in fibrosis and elsewhere within the fragmented areas there is focal epithelial proliferation focally with a cribriform architecture, associated with stroma - withsome features suggestive of a papillary lesion." Any one know anything about a papillary lesions, or what this report means? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: pathology report - papillary lesion? torontomom torontomom

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2008 04:36AM torontomom wrote: so, its dcis...close margins, reexcission and radiaiton...I guess i'm moving on to the next group....
Posts.Title: pathology report - papillary lesion? torontomom torontomom
